types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: RootQueryToCategoryConnectionWhereArgs
types.description: Arguments for filtering the RootQueryToCategoryConnection connection

inputFields.name: cacheDomain
inputFields.description: Unique cache key to be produced when this query is stored in an object cache. Default is 'core'.

inputFields.name: childOf
inputFields.description: Term ID to retrieve child terms of. If multiple taxonomies are passed, $child_of is ignored. Default 0.

inputFields.name: childless
inputFields.description: True to limit results to terms that have no children. This parameter has no effect on non-hierarchical taxonomies. Default false.

inputFields.name: descriptionLike
inputFields.description: Retrieve terms where the description is LIKE the input value. Default empty.

inputFields.name: exclude
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to exclude. If $include is non-empty, $exclude is ignored. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: excludeTree
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to exclude along with all of their descendant terms. If $include is non-empty, $exclude_tree is ignored. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: hideEmpty
inputFields.description: Whether to hide terms not assigned to any posts. Accepts true or false. Default false

inputFields.name: hierarchical
inputFields.description: Whether to include terms that have non-empty descendants (even if $hide_empty is set to true). Default true.

inputFields.name: include
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to include. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Array of names to return term(s) for. Default empty.

inputFields.name: nameLike
inputFields.description: Retrieve terms where the name is LIKE the input value. Default empty.

inputFields.name: objectIds
inputFields.description: Array of object IDs. Results will be limited to terms associated with these objects.

inputFields.name: orderby
inputFields.description: Field(s) to order terms by. Defaults to 'name'.

inputFields.name: padCounts
inputFields.description: Whether to pad the quantity of a term's children in the quantity of each term's "count" object variable. Default false.

inputFields.name: parent
inputFields.description: Parent term ID to retrieve direct-child terms of. Default empty.

inputFields.name: search
inputFields.description: Search criteria to match terms. Will be SQL-formatted with wildcards before and after. Default empty.

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: Array of slugs to return term(s) for. Default empty.

inputFields.name: termTaxonomId
inputFields.description: Array of term taxonomy IDs, to match when querying terms.

inputFields.name: updateTermMetaCache
inputFields.description: Whether to prime meta caches for matched terms. Default true.

inputFields.name: cacheDomain
inputFields.description: Unique cache key to be produced when this query is stored in an object cache. Default is 'core'.

inputFields.name: childOf
inputFields.description: Term ID to retrieve child terms of. If multiple taxonomies are passed, $child_of is ignored. Default 0.

inputFields.name: childless
inputFields.description: True to limit results to terms that have no children. This parameter has no effect on non-hierarchical taxonomies. Default false.

inputFields.name: descriptionLike
inputFields.description: Retrieve terms where the description is LIKE the input value. Default empty.

inputFields.name: exclude
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to exclude. If $include is non-empty, $exclude is ignored. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: excludeTree
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to exclude along with all of their descendant terms. If $include is non-empty, $exclude_tree is ignored. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: hideEmpty
inputFields.description: Whether to hide terms not assigned to any posts. Accepts true or false. Default false

inputFields.name: hierarchical
inputFields.description: Whether to include terms that have non-empty descendants (even if $hide_empty is set to true). Default true.

inputFields.name: include
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to include. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Array of names to return term(s) for. Default empty.

inputFields.name: nameLike
inputFields.description: Retrieve terms where the name is LIKE the input value. Default empty.

inputFields.name: objectIds
inputFields.description: Array of object IDs. Results will be limited to terms associated with these objects.

inputFields.name: orderby
inputFields.description: Field(s) to order terms by. Defaults to 'name'.

inputFields.name: padCounts
inputFields.description: Whether to pad the quantity of a term's children in the quantity of each term's "count" object variable. Default false.

inputFields.name: parent
inputFields.description: Parent term ID to retrieve direct-child terms of. Default empty.

inputFields.name: search
inputFields.description: Search criteria to match terms. Will be SQL-formatted with wildcards before and after. Default empty.

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: Array of slugs to return term(s) for. Default empty.

inputFields.name: termTaxonomId
inputFields.description: Array of term taxonomy IDs, to match when querying terms.

inputFields.name: updateTermMetaCache
inputFields.description: Whether to prime meta caches for matched terms. Default true.

types.name: AvatarRatingEnum
types.description: What rating to display avatars up to. Accepts 'G', 'PG', 'R', 'X', and are judged in that order. Default is the value of the 'avatar_rating' option

types.name: Avatar
types.description: Avatars are profile images for users. WordPress by default uses the Gravatar service to host and fetch avatars from.

fields.name: default
fields.description: URL for the default image or a default type. Accepts '404' (return a 404 instead of a default image), 'retro' (8bit), 'monsterid' (monster), 'wavatar' (cartoon face), 'indenticon' (the 'quilt'), 'mystery', 'mm', or 'mysteryman' (The Oyster Man), 'blank' (transparent GIF), or 'gravatar_default' (the Gravatar logo).

fields.name: extraAttr
fields.description: HTML attributes to insert in the IMG element. Is not sanitized.

fields.name: forceDefault
fields.description: Whether to always show the default image, never the Gravatar.

fields.name: foundAvatar
fields.description: Whether the avatar was successfully found.

fields.name: height
fields.description: Height of the avatar image.

fields.name: isRestricted
fields.description: Whether the object is restricted from the current viewer

fields.name: rating
fields.description: What rating to display avatars up to. Accepts 'G', 'PG', 'R', 'X', and are judged in that order.

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: Type of url scheme to use. Typically HTTP vs. HTTPS.

fields.name: size
fields.description: The size of the avatar in pixels. A value of 96 will match a 96px x 96px gravatar image.

fields.name: url
fields.description: URL for the gravatar image source.

fields.name: width
fields.description: Width of the avatar image.

types.name: ContentNodeToTermNodeConnectionWhereArgs
types.description: Arguments for filtering the ContentNodeToTermNodeConnection connection

inputFields.name: cacheDomain
inputFields.description: Unique cache key to be produced when this query is stored in an object cache. Default is 'core'.

inputFields.name: childOf
inputFields.description: Term ID to retrieve child terms of. If multiple taxonomies are passed, $child_of is ignored. Default 0.

inputFields.name: childless
inputFields.description: True to limit results to terms that have no children. This parameter has no effect on non-hierarchical taxonomies. Default false.

inputFields.name: descriptionLike
inputFields.description: Retrieve terms where the description is LIKE the input value. Default empty.

inputFields.name: exclude
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to exclude. If $include is non-empty, $exclude is ignored. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: excludeTree
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to exclude along with all of their descendant terms. If $include is non-empty, $exclude_tree is ignored. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: hideEmpty
inputFields.description: Whether to hide terms not assigned to any posts. Accepts true or false. Default false

inputFields.name: hierarchical
inputFields.description: Whether to include terms that have non-empty descendants (even if $hide_empty is set to true). Default true.

inputFields.name: include
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to include. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Array of names to return term(s) for. Default empty.

inputFields.name: nameLike
inputFields.description: Retrieve terms where the name is LIKE the input value. Default empty.

inputFields.name: objectIds
inputFields.description: Array of object IDs. Results will be limited to terms associated with these objects.

inputFields.name: orderby
inputFields.description: Field(s) to order terms by. Defaults to 'name'.

inputFields.name: padCounts
inputFields.description: Whether to pad the quantity of a term's children in the quantity of each term's "count" object variable. Default false.

inputFields.name: parent
inputFields.description: Parent term ID to retrieve direct-child terms of. Default empty.

inputFields.name: search
inputFields.description: Search criteria to match terms. Will be SQL-formatted with wildcards before and after. Default empty.

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: Array of slugs to return term(s) for. Default empty.

inputFields.name: taxonomies
inputFields.description: The Taxonomy to filter terms by

inputFields.name: termTaxonomId
inputFields.description: Array of term taxonomy IDs, to match when querying terms.

inputFields.name: updateTermMetaCache
inputFields.description: Whether to prime meta caches for matched terms. Default true.

types.name: PostToCategoryConnectionWhereArgs
types.description: Arguments for filtering the PostToCategoryConnection connection

inputFields.name: cacheDomain
inputFields.description: Unique cache key to be produced when this query is stored in an object cache. Default is 'core'.

inputFields.name: childOf
inputFields.description: Term ID to retrieve child terms of. If multiple taxonomies are passed, $child_of is ignored. Default 0.

inputFields.name: childless
inputFields.description: True to limit results to terms that have no children. This parameter has no effect on non-hierarchical taxonomies. Default false.

inputFields.name: descriptionLike
inputFields.description: Retrieve terms where the description is LIKE the input value. Default empty.

inputFields.name: exclude
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to exclude. If $include is non-empty, $exclude is ignored. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: excludeTree
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to exclude along with all of their descendant terms. If $include is non-empty, $exclude_tree is ignored. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: hideEmpty
inputFields.description: Whether to hide terms not assigned to any posts. Accepts true or false. Default false

inputFields.name: hierarchical
inputFields.description: Whether to include terms that have non-empty descendants (even if $hide_empty is set to true). Default true.

inputFields.name: include
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to include. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Array of names to return term(s) for. Default empty.

inputFields.name: nameLike
inputFields.description: Retrieve terms where the name is LIKE the input value. Default empty.

inputFields.name: objectIds
inputFields.description: Array of object IDs. Results will be limited to terms associated with these objects.

inputFields.name: orderby
inputFields.description: Field(s) to order terms by. Defaults to 'name'.

inputFields.name: padCounts
inputFields.description: Whether to pad the quantity of a term's children in the quantity of each term's "count" object variable. Default false.

inputFields.name: parent
inputFields.description: Parent term ID to retrieve direct-child terms of. Default empty.

inputFields.name: search
inputFields.description: Search criteria to match terms. Will be SQL-formatted with wildcards before and after. Default empty.

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: Array of slugs to return term(s) for. Default empty.

inputFields.name: termTaxonomId
inputFields.description: Array of term taxonomy IDs, to match when querying terms.

inputFields.name: updateTermMetaCache
inputFields.description: Whether to prime meta caches for matched terms. Default true.

types.name: PostToTagConnectionWhereArgs
types.description: Arguments for filtering the PostToTagConnection connection

inputFields.name: cacheDomain
inputFields.description: Unique cache key to be produced when this query is stored in an object cache. Default is 'core'.

inputFields.name: childOf
inputFields.description: Term ID to retrieve child terms of. If multiple taxonomies are passed, $child_of is ignored. Default 0.

inputFields.name: childless
inputFields.description: True to limit results to terms that have no children. This parameter has no effect on non-hierarchical taxonomies. Default false.

inputFields.name: descriptionLike
inputFields.description: Retrieve terms where the description is LIKE the input value. Default empty.

inputFields.name: exclude
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to exclude. If $include is non-empty, $exclude is ignored. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: excludeTree
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to exclude along with all of their descendant terms. If $include is non-empty, $exclude_tree is ignored. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: hideEmpty
inputFields.description: Whether to hide terms not assigned to any posts. Accepts true or false. Default false

inputFields.name: hierarchical
inputFields.description: Whether to include terms that have non-empty descendants (even if $hide_empty is set to true). Default true.

inputFields.name: include
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to include. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Array of names to return term(s) for. Default empty.

inputFields.name: nameLike
inputFields.description: Retrieve terms where the name is LIKE the input value. Default empty.

inputFields.name: objectIds
inputFields.description: Array of object IDs. Results will be limited to terms associated with these objects.

inputFields.name: orderby
inputFields.description: Field(s) to order terms by. Defaults to 'name'.

inputFields.name: padCounts
inputFields.description: Whether to pad the quantity of a term's children in the quantity of each term's "count" object variable. Default false.

inputFields.name: parent
inputFields.description: Parent term ID to retrieve direct-child terms of. Default empty.

inputFields.name: search
inputFields.description: Search criteria to match terms. Will be SQL-formatted with wildcards before and after. Default empty.

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: Array of slugs to return term(s) for. Default empty.

inputFields.name: termTaxonomId
inputFields.description: Array of term taxonomy IDs, to match when querying terms.

inputFields.name: updateTermMetaCache
inputFields.description: Whether to prime meta caches for matched terms. Default true.

types.name: RootQueryToPostFormatConnectionWhereArgs
types.description: Arguments for filtering the RootQueryToPostFormatConnection connection

inputFields.name: cacheDomain
inputFields.description: Unique cache key to be produced when this query is stored in an object cache. Default is 'core'.

inputFields.name: childOf
inputFields.description: Term ID to retrieve child terms of. If multiple taxonomies are passed, $child_of is ignored. Default 0.

inputFields.name: childless
inputFields.description: True to limit results to terms that have no children. This parameter has no effect on non-hierarchical taxonomies. Default false.

inputFields.name: descriptionLike
inputFields.description: Retrieve terms where the description is LIKE the input value. Default empty.

inputFields.name: exclude
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to exclude. If $include is non-empty, $exclude is ignored. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: excludeTree
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to exclude along with all of their descendant terms. If $include is non-empty, $exclude_tree is ignored. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: hideEmpty
inputFields.description: Whether to hide terms not assigned to any posts. Accepts true or false. Default false

inputFields.name: hierarchical
inputFields.description: Whether to include terms that have non-empty descendants (even if $hide_empty is set to true). Default true.

inputFields.name: include
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to include. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Array of names to return term(s) for. Default empty.

inputFields.name: nameLike
inputFields.description: Retrieve terms where the name is LIKE the input value. Default empty.

inputFields.name: objectIds
inputFields.description: Array of object IDs. Results will be limited to terms associated with these objects.

inputFields.name: orderby
inputFields.description: Field(s) to order terms by. Defaults to 'name'.

inputFields.name: padCounts
inputFields.description: Whether to pad the quantity of a term's children in the quantity of each term's "count" object variable. Default false.

inputFields.name: parent
inputFields.description: Parent term ID to retrieve direct-child terms of. Default empty.

inputFields.name: search
inputFields.description: Search criteria to match terms. Will be SQL-formatted with wildcards before and after. Default empty.

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: Array of slugs to return term(s) for. Default empty.

inputFields.name: termTaxonomId
inputFields.description: Array of term taxonomy IDs, to match when querying terms.

inputFields.name: updateTermMetaCache
inputFields.description: Whether to prime meta caches for matched terms. Default true.

inputFields.description: True to limit results to terms that have no children. This parameter has no effect on non-hierarchical taxonomies. Default false.

inputFields.name: descriptionLike
inputFields.description: Retrieve terms where the description is LIKE the input value. Default empty.

inputFields.name: exclude
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to exclude. If $include is non-empty, $exclude is ignored. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: excludeTree
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to exclude along with all of their descendant terms. If $include is non-empty, $exclude_tree is ignored. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: hideEmpty
inputFields.description: Whether to hide terms not assigned to any posts. Accepts true or false. Default false

inputFields.name: hierarchical
inputFields.description: Whether to include terms that have non-empty descendants (even if $hide_empty is set to true). Default true.

inputFields.name: include
inputFields.description: Array of term ids to include. Default empty array.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Array of names to return term(s) for. Default empty.

inputFields.name: nameLike
inputFields.description: Retrieve terms where the name is LIKE the input value. Default empty.

inputFields.name: objectIds
inputFields.description: Array of object IDs. Results will be limited to terms associated with these objects.

inputFields.name: orderby
inputFields.description: Field(s) to order terms by. Defaults to 'name'.

inputFields.name: padCounts
inputFields.description: Whether to pad the quantity of a term's children in the quantity of each term's "count" object variable. Default false.

inputFields.name: parent
inputFields.description: Parent term ID to retrieve direct-child terms of. Default empty.

inputFields.name: search
inputFields.description: Search criteria to match terms. Will be SQL-formatted with wildcards before and after. Default empty.

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: Array of slugs to return term(s) for. Default empty.

inputFields.name: taxonomies
inputFields.description: The Taxonomy to filter terms by

inputFields.name: termTaxonomId
inputFields.description: Array of term taxonomy IDs, to match when querying terms.

inputFields.name: updateTermMetaCache
inputFields.description: Whether to prime meta caches for matched terms. Default true.

types.name: UpdateCategoryInput
types.description: Input for the UpdateCategory mutation

inputFields.name: aliasOf
inputFields.description: The slug that the category will be an alias of

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: The description of the category object

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The ID of the category object to update

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the category object to mutate

inputFields.name: parentId
inputFields.description: The ID of the category that should be set as the parent

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: If this argument exists then the slug will be checked to see if it is not an existing valid term. If that check succeeds (it is not a valid term), then it is added and the term id is given. If it fails, then a check is made to whether the taxonomy is hierarchical and the parent argument is not empty. If the second check succeeds, the term will be inserted and the term id will be given. If the slug argument is empty, then it will be calculated from the term name.

types.name: PostCategoriesInput
types.description: Set relationships between the post to categories

inputFields.name: append
inputFields.description: If true, this will append the category to existing related categories. If false, this will replace existing relationships. Default true.

types.name: PostCategoriesNodeInput
types.description: List of categories to connect the post to. If an ID is set, it will be used to create the connection. If not, it will look for a slug. If neither are valid existing terms, and the site is configured to allow terms to be created during post mutations, a term will be created using the Name if it exists in the input, then fallback to the slug if it exists.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: The description of the category. This field is used to set a description of the category if a new one is created during the mutation.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The ID of the category. If present, this will be used to connect to the post. If no existing category exists with this ID, no connection will be made.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the category. This field is used to create a new term, if term creation is enabled in nested mutations, and if one does not already exist with the provided slug or ID or if a slug or ID is not provided. If no name is included and a term is created, the creation will fallback to the slug field.

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: The slug of the category. If no ID is present, this field will be used to make a connection. If no existing term exists with this slug, this field will be used as a fallback to the Name field when creating a new term to connect to, if term creation is enabled as a nested mutation.

types.name: PostPostFormatsInput
types.description: Set relationships between the post to postFormats

inputFields.name: append
inputFields.description: If true, this will append the postFormat to existing related postFormats. If false, this will replace existing relationships. Default true.

types.name: PostPostFormatsNodeInput
types.description: List of postFormats to connect the post to. If an ID is set, it will be used to create the connection. If not, it will look for a slug. If neither are valid existing terms, and the site is configured to allow terms to be created during post mutations, a term will be created using the Name if it exists in the input, then fallback to the slug if it exists.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: The description of the postFormat. This field is used to set a description of the postFormat if a new one is created during the mutation.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The ID of the postFormat. If present, this will be used to connect to the post. If no existing postFormat exists with this ID, no connection will be made.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the postFormat. This field is used to create a new term, if term creation is enabled in nested mutations, and if one does not already exist with the provided slug or ID or if a slug or ID is not provided. If no name is included and a term is created, the creation will fallback to the slug field.

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: The slug of the postFormat. If no ID is present, this field will be used to make a connection. If no existing term exists with this slug, this field will be used as a fallback to the Name field when creating a new term to connect to, if term creation is enabled as a nested mutation.

types.name: PostTagsInput

inputFields.description: If true, this will append the tag to existing related tags. If false, this will replace existing relationships. Default true.

types.name: PostTagsNodeInput
types.description: List of tags to connect the post to. If an ID is set, it will be used to create the connection. If not, it will look for a slug. If neither are valid existing terms, and the site is configured to allow terms to be created during post mutations, a term will be created using the Name if it exists in the input, then fallback to the slug if it exists.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: The description of the tag. This field is used to set a description of the tag if a new one is created during the mutation.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The ID of the tag. If present, this will be used to connect to the post. If no existing tag exists with this ID, no connection will be made.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the tag. This field is used to create a new term, if term creation is enabled in nested mutations, and if one does not already exist with the provided slug or ID or if a slug or ID is not provided. If no name is included and a term is created, the creation will fallback to the slug field.

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: The slug of the tag. If no ID is present, this field will be used to make a connection. If no existing term exists with this slug, this field will be used as a fallback to the Name field when creating a new term to connect to, if term creation is enabled as a nested mutation.

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: If this argument exists then the slug will be checked to see if it is not an existing valid term. If that check succeeds (it is not a valid term), then it is added and the term id is given. If it fails, then a check is made to whether the taxonomy is hierarchical and the parent argument is not empty. If the second check succeeds, the term will be inserted and the term id will be given. If the slug argument is empty, then it will be calculated from the term name.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
